programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Placentia, California, where Rene and Casey buy a locker full of luggage. Meanwhile, Barry is left pondering his future.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen face their toughest challenge yet when two old rivals join forces, and the guys find an off-road motorcycle and a pair of net guns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Big Sis revamp the shop to help bring in more customers. Plus, Allen unearths a set of antique basketballs, and goes toe-to-toe with an NBA Hall of Famer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo find a valuable collection of vintage toys in Iowa, while Mike is inspired to take a gamble on an unusual item.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A hunter is forced to put his own life on the line to save his partner, and another swamper crashes through a beaver dam as the season reaches its climax.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Tensions between Jamie and Adam boil over as they try to flip a B-train on a narrow icy road. Elsewhere, a two-car collision throws Ken into action. Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick struggles to get a good deal for a flame-thrower, while Corey and Chumlee head to an auction to bid for a classic gypsy fortune-telling machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine an explosive set of Soviet nuclear missile launch keys and a 1920s Gibson ukulele banjo. Rick Harrison also encounters two of the biggest guns he has ever seen.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. A ventriloquist leaves Karen and Bobby J speechless, and an angry mixed martial arts fighter takes a swing at Byron.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds' million-dollar art deal takes more twists and turns, but eventually Les shakes hands on the single biggest purchase in store history.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the notion that extraterrestrials could have left clues to the universe's mysteries. Experts investigate cryptic puzzles that might have been placed by ancient aliens.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the CIA's rumoured investment in psychological operations, asking if there could be an army of remote viewers watching the American public today.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating evidence that suggests the US military has been under attack from aliens for the past 50 years, asking if a huge secret could be being kept out of the public eye.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have the opportunity of a lifetime when they stumble upon pieces of art that could be worth millions. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hands out his biggest loan ever on a luxurious Rolls Royce, hoping this latest gamble will pay off and not leave his ego in tatters.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers deliberate over a 1964 Austin Healey, a 2006 NBA Championship ring and a rare diving helmet from the 1800s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get lucky when a pirate's peg leg is brought into the shop. Rich gets the chance to buy a top-quality archery bow, and a man arrives with a full-sized wooden motorcycle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover their latest purchase could be worth $25,000, while Darrell buys some video game memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: High Noon in the High Desert
programme.desc: Barry discovers the personal possessions of rap magnate Suge Knight, while Jarrod and Dave aim to buy a classic organ.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen are in Nashville, Tennessee, where they meet a band of tough, high-bidding bikers before discovering a 37mm anti-tank gun and a cowboy's rodeo saddle.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Big Sis reveals bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction. Meanwhile, Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Engineering Disasters
programme.desc: How the negligence and bad planning of engineers has inadvertently resulted in some of history's worst tragedies, starting with a look at what caused a number of manhole covers to explode.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating the possibility of time travel, with experts discussing new evidence suggesting that this phenomenon of science fiction might not be as far-fetched as it seems.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the places Hitler and members of his inner circle could have fled to, should the theories about them surviving the fall of Berlin be valid.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigators find evidence suggesting that ancient aliens saved humanity from great floods, and contemplate whether mankind may one day need to rely on the intervention of extra-terrestrials again.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les puts the kibosh on Seth's outlandish plan to boost business, father and son head to the race track to decide who's boss. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds gear up to shoot a new commercial for the store, but the signs are that not everyone will be happy with the final result. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth harbour some serious doubts after Karen brings in a Feng Shui expert in the hope of boosting sales and gaining a positive energy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones get taken down by their fiercest opponent CJ, but a twist of fate keeps them in the game.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: In Covina, California, Allen Haff and Ton Jones face Carolyn at an auction, before they make a decision on the future of the shop.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A wildfire tears across California, a mother runs from a tornado, and a rescue team tries to reach a canoeist trapped in a tree during a fatal flood.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when a notorious terrorist sets off a bomb on Philippine Airlines Flight 434, leaving one dead and 10 injured.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry adopts a disguise at an auction in Stanton, while Darrell gets himself banned from bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon and guests Richard Osman, Jessie Cave and Darren Harriott discuss, categorise and rank worries to do with Modern Living. Has inventing got out of hand? Is magic dead?.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Jo Brand, Roisin Conaty and Paul Foot, and TV wildlife presenter Ray Mears.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Colin Lane, Sarah Millican and Noel Fielding join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'numbers' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan, TV presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Nish Kumar and historian Suzannah Lipscomb join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Mary, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers face disaster when they are surrounded by a Simulant Death Ship and a fleet of Annihilators while hiding in an asteroid, and it is up to Arnold J Rimmer to save them. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo travel to London, where they consider buying a rare motorbike and a telephone box with a risque history.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright wins big money, and Brandon goes out on a limb - but gets no help from Lori.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott makes a large bid for Oktoberfest items, while Brandon and Lori investigate a crime scene bin. US documentary following Brandon Bernier as he buys storage units at auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank uncover an impressive hoard, and strike gold in an unusual prop shop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank get behind the wheel of the original Batmobile from the 1960s TV series Batman, and pay a visit to Grizzly Adams actor Dan Haggerty's treasure-filled California home.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage from Barcelona of an event where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May each buy a rear-wheel-drive coupe for Â£1,500 and find themselves entered into a French ice race. Richard discovers a way to fill the waiting time for flights by inventing the sport of airport-vehicle racing, Jeremy gets behind the wheel of the BMW Z4, and actress Sienna Miller is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: Before lights out to start the Formula 1 season in Australia, the programme gains access behind the scenes at F1 team Haas as they pack tonnes of cars and gear for air freighting.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for Â£3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the series finale, Noel Fielding finds an unlikely soul mate, Lolly Adefope shows everyone the money, and Mel Giedroyc bites off more than she can chew.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are EastEnders star June Brown, comedians Aisling Bea and Seann Walsh, and football presenter Adrian Chiles.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Claudia Winkleman, Miles Jupp, Bob Mortimer, Jo Brand, Adil Ray, Kirsty Wark, Amanda Abbington and Carol Vorderman to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Chris Packham, actor Paul Feig, comedian Jon Richardson and historian Kate Williams join host Sue Perkins and captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy panel show. In this edition, the two sides answer questions about famous people past and present who share the name Ben, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker - prompting comic banter, funny facts and unusual stats as the teams vie to outdo each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Lucy Porter, Frankie Boyle and Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'next' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua plucks up the courage to ask Naomi out, only to find she's already lined up another date. Ricky's plan to save the day backfires and Mario has a big date of his own to go on.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets Aisling Bea, Bob Mortimer, Mark Watson, Nish Kumar and Sally Phillips brilliantly bewildering tasks, including basketball without hands.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: Paul Danan finally gets his day in court with Shaun Williamson after a pantomime-based fallout, while a husband is sick and tired of his miserly wife ruining Christmas.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the steam train reached the height of its importance in Europe just as fresh innovations were being made in America, with groundbreaking trains like the Burlington Zephyr.

programme.title: Remarkable Rwanda
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the diverse and different aspects of the African country, from magnificent mountain gorillas to one of the world's largest colobus monkey colonies.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team discovers a DNA match between a medical student reported missing six years previously and a corpse that was found at around the same time. Investigations into the man's background reveal he had been suspected of having links to terrorist organisations - but Boyd believes a high-level cover-up is obscuring the whole truth about the case. Guest starring Don Warrington.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Lizzie must deal with her mother's bold defence of the York cause, while the appearance of a boy in Burgundy claiming to be a young prince threatens to further destabilise King Henry's rule. King Henry's mother Lady Margaret Beaufort faces the consequences of harbouring a dark secret. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Rene suspects he is standing in the way of Sarah's happiness after witnessing a moment of yearning, while Andrew disturbs Anna and Gino's honeymoon bliss. Elsewhere, George makes an announcement.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Military drama series charting the lives of the men and women of the King's Own Fusiliers regiment. In the opening episode, the officers return from a tour in Northern Ireland after tragedy strikes. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Teenage rapist Ross Trescot is brought into custody, but his arrest does little to comfort June, who insists in being interviewed by Sheelagh, unable to bear the thought of reliving her ordeal with a stranger. Yvonne also faces a stressful time as she gives evidence at the inquest into Lee Thomas's death. Colleagues support her during the day, but a verdict of unlawful killing is recorded and she faces the unsettling prospect of being charged with murder. Away from the line of duty, Phil Hunter grows increasingly uneasy as Kate plans their wedding and finally admits he is still married to Cindy - prompting her to throw him out of the house.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Chrissie panics when Don Bosman returns to the hospital to retrieve Helena's body and finds out her heart was donated without his consent. Dillon's condition worsens following his re-admission, leading Sam to discover he has failed to conquer his drinking habit. Meanwhile, jealousy gets the better of Kyla, who berates Justin for behaving unprofessionally after catching him flirting with Donna.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max gets in the way of the struggle to save his son Frank's life. Meanwhile, a bizarre coincidence reunites a mother and son, and Charlie's least favourite patient causes a scene. Hospital drama, starring Derek Thompson, Robert Gwilym and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: At the End of a Long Day
programme.desc: Yvonne sets off for Barton Street Station to face formal manslaughter charges but has a run-in with a drunk en route and ends up hitting him - which won't exactly count in her favour when she appears in court. Jo Masters discovers one of Phil's informants is dealing in drugs with the collusion of a crooked customs officer, while Roger and Dan find a missing schoolgirl in woodlands and realise she has just given birth - but can't see any sign of her baby.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie is trying to find a solution about working for Ian. Pauline refuses to have Arthur back. Gita would like to visit her sick mother in India.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Chrissy has a plan but wants Arthur to support her, Frank is going out of his mind trying to find out news about his pregnant daughter.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bayleaf hands in his resignation. Meanwhile, the fire-fighters are called to a fire at a registry office, and Remy and Kevin quarrel about Mickey.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: The legacy of Paul and Lexie's secret kiss strains relations between them, but despite initial reservations, she reconsiders her decision to leave Glenbogle. Duncan decides the time is right for him to make changes in his life, and steps in to help a begrudging Ewan out when an accident incapacitates him. Meanwhile, Duncan and Molly reveal details of a hidden past that threaten to have dramatic implications for the rest of the family.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna receives a poignant reminder of her painful break-up with Simon and the Lampards agonise over whether to let Oscar's real dad see him, afraid of the emotional consequences. Joe takes Beth's rejection badly, while Karen has a traumatic encounter with Garth at Tessie Banks' funeral and later finds herself forced to save his life in a tense scene on the edge of windswept Blackscar Top.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien may have ulterior motives for inviting Tracey to a posh event, while Sharon makes a tidy profit out of fake Rolling Stones T-shirts. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel are eager for Sandy and Harry's return from Canada.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Sid attempts to install a doorbell in his cafe, so Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to assist - with disastrous consequences. John Comer, Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The circus brings death to Kembleford when a clown is murdered, and Father Brown hunts the killer while trying to determine why a parishioner has agreed to marry the sinister wizard Welkin. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Doctor Blake has to piece together arson and a fatal shooting of a farmer. Meanwhile, a leak to the paper concerning the medic creates difficulties for his relationship with Jean. Australian drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In their first case without trusty colleague Jack, the team members reinvestigate the disappearance of PE teacher Jason Bowe when the remains of a body are discovered near the elite public boarding school where he taught. Unfortunately, their snooping could not have come at a worse time for the staff, who are preparing to welcome a local MP to open their new computer centre - but what they do glean tells them the dead man seemed very much a loner. However, it soon turns out he got on much better with his students, forming close and inappropriate relationships with several. But could his behaviour have rattled someone enough to kill him? Susannah Harker and Nicola Walker guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. Sarring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Marc Warren steps into the shoes of Barry Foster to take on the role of Dutch detective Van der Valk in this updated adaptation of the Amsterdam-based crime drama. Two seemingly unrelated men are found murdered in different parts of the city on the same day. Are the deaths connected, and if so, could there be a link to the disappearance of a student activist? Commissaris Van Der Valk must uncover the truth while also dealing with an over-eager rookie cop joining his tight-knit team. Maimie McCoy, Luke Allen-Gale and Elliot Barnes Worrell co-star.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as more studio audience members are called down to play against arguably the most formidable quiz team on TV. First up is a cash builder of five questions, after which they have the option of playing between two, three, four or all of the Chasers for increasing amounts of money - and those brave enough to take on all five could walk away with a huge cash prize.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Fly Tipping: Britain's Lockdown Problem? Tonight
programme.desc: Fly tipping costs tens of millions to clean up and is a huge problem across the UK. But it could be getting worse in lockdown. With some council tips shut and many authorities operating a skeleton waste collection service, some people are simply dumping their rubbish illegally. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Christine Lampard, Denise Welch, and Gloria Hunniford are on the Loose Women panel, joined by Amber Gill and Clive Mantle.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James visits the Shetland Islands, an area of natural beauty that he's always wanted to see. He gets to hire a vintage car to explore the area, where he learns about traditional fish salting and cooks a tasty vegetable curry at a local social enterprise project. Later on, James learns all about Shetland community spirit and cake at one of their famous Sunday teas, and finally cooks up a Shetland-inspired paella on a beautiful local beach.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five contestants calling themselves 'The Rowley Polys' answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will is startled to see the scale of the drug order he is being told to courier and even more shocked when he realises Billy and Cain are being used as decoys to draw police attention away from him. Chas is shocked at how much Paddy has been struggling with Eve, and Andrea struggles to keep a cool demeanour in front of Jamie and Millie.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Matters come to a head between Geoff and Yasmeen after another traumatic series of events, which begin with Geoff locking his long-suffering partner in the house having first confiscated her phone.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Chris Hoy, Martine McCutcheon and Faye Tozer to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win Â£50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: After a week of people from across the UK willing to take on Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, more contestants come forward hoping to win big money by conquering the Chasers. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Piers meets Caitlyn Jenner, who for the first 65 years of her life was known as Bruce, a former Olympic gold medal-winning decathlete. Looking back at her remarkable life, she opens up about her feud with her ex-wife and stepchildren in the Kardashian family, reflects on winning Olympic gold while simultaneously battling gender issues and discusses the death of her younger brother.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: After a week of people from across the UK willing to take on Jenny 'The Vixen' Ryan, Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty, Shaun 'The Dark Destroyer' Wallace, Mark 'The Beast' Labbett and Paul 'The Sinnerman' Sinha, more contestants come forward hoping to win big money by conquering the Chasers. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in designing cars that offer the maximum protection in a crash. Plus, how books are printed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work on an old VW camper van, changing the exhaust and completing a diesel service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work on the camper van is completed, and the finished article proves very popular when it is snapped up by a buyer straight away.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton acquires an extremely rare - and valuable - German Panther tank - and its original undercoat is more pink than camouflage. However, getting parts is a struggle.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: After Odie gets fired, he returns to OCC and gives Sr the inside track on the PJD shop. And when Sr reaches out to Jr in a public way, he is met with suspicion.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: An exploration of the technology behind the world's most powerful ships, including cruise liners and oil tankers.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe struggles to keep up with professional crawfish pickers in Louisiana, and discovers how termite researchers find and remove the insects.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Revealing how items such as sidecars, frozen French toast, refrigerator compressors and superchargers are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Revealing how items such as sidecars, frozen French toast, refrigerator compressors and superchargers are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how wood-burning stoves work, and how the development of the synthesiser helped change music for ever.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Paul Cowland has an epic restoration on his hands when Drew Pritchard falls in love with and buys an automotive design classic, a Fiat 130 coupe, that has a serious corrosion problem.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Kodiak's crane breaks, resulting in an injury that forces a crew member to retire to his bunk. Meanwhile, a rookie fisherman has a breakdown on board the Seabrooke.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Winter storms are set to rage, which could halt all diving for weeks, and the crews have to find new ways to keep the abalone coming in and secure their income.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Justin gambles thousands of dollars as he struggles over the season. Opal queen Kelly is in desperate need for a big find underground and Aaron and Greg's claim might pay off.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer visits Idaho to buy a Karmann Ghia, but a broken gearbox and damaged interior could stop him and Edd China from making a profit on the sale of the restored vehicle.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini checks out a valuable collection of vehicles found in an avocado field. Meanwhile, a fellow enthusiast makes a rare find.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini heads to California to secure a Davis, a vehicle reminiscent of an overgrown bumper car. Powered by a V-8 engine, only 13 were produced in the late 1940s.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a dutch company make the world's fastest super-yachts. Plus, a new space suit that weighs and costs a fifth of the previous design.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating seemingly simple modern-day objects. This time, how rowing machines, Parma ham and London Underground signs are made.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Amanda Bichard wants to prove she's more than a pretty face in a male-dominated profession, determined to make it as an abalone diver. Veteran diver David 'Bucky' Buckland has leased a new boat, but it has not arrived and his debt is escalating.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Tensions rise on board the Northwestern, and a Wizard deckhand falls asleep at the wheel, placing the boat on a collision course with nearby vessels.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Drew Pritchard finds a huge horse's head with a dealer specialising in sculptures. In Somerset he spots a valuable Persian rug lining a chicken shed.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Upholsterer Craig tries to restore a Robert Dawes reclining library chair. Plus, Alex takes on a big project with a near pair of two Dutch 18th-century marquetry tables.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work on an old VW camper van, changing the exhaust and completing a diesel service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work on the camper van is completed, and the finished article proves very popular when it is snapped up by a buyer straight away.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard visits a stately home in Barnstaple, where he tries to charm Lady Arran. Then, he finds plenty of neon treats in Bournemouth.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: A dangerous storm threatens to shut down the operation just as Darrell and team discover gold in the remains of an old wreck.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Tension grow among the crew after a rash move by Farley leaves him broken and bedridden, and morale sinks even lower via equipment failure, and a beached boat.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating banknotes, and how leather hide is turned into a pair of shoes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring how fish are farmed, raw cane is turned into sugar, and suits are tailored in just one day.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case in which a couple, recently engaged, were found brutally murdered in a car. Footage from a surveillance camera gave the police their first break.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The tools of detection are at the forefront of technology. This programme reveals the groundbreaking techniques being employed to catch deadly killers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The disappearance of a 22-year-old nursing assistant. When police checked local CCTV footage, they discovered that Carlesha Freeland-Gaither was abducted on camera.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a businessman who flew to Florida to make a million-dollar deal but was never seen again, leaving the FBI with few leads to follow.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A cruelty investigator is responding to a call from the sheriff's department. A pony has been dragged down a road, leaving it crippled with pain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown examines a dog that jumped out of a moving car to chase a cat.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown prepares to visit his parents, but receives an emergency call about a python that is struggling after swallowing something.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Norah is shopping with her family, while the consultants search for a gown for a bride with a fashion savvy entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A consultant meets 18-year-old bride Kelsey, who arrives with plenty of drama over a broken promise about who would be her maid of honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Michael and Chris have different visions for their wedding and tension soon rises between the pair as Lori tries to find some common ground.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A Shar Pei dog's excessive folds of skin threaten to damage its eyesight, so Dr Chris Brown performs a nip-tuck operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A dog gets hit by a car, pooch Ava eats a G-string, a distressed mother loses her joey and a canine gets hung out of a window upside-down.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The agents are sent to rescue a three-legged Labrador and bring the animal back to the sanctuary in a bid to teach it how to overcome its limitations.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A man is caught on camera abusing a dog, and a horse needs help after collapsing.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists reconstruct the scene of a bludgeoning in Georgia, USA, in an attempt to track down the suspect in a murder investigation.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of big game hunter Bob, who was is fooled by a predatory con-artist and put a $1,000 deposit on a non-existent Thunderbird.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25 year-old college graduate Mitrice Richardson, whose semi-decomposed body was found close by a marijuana farm in the Santa Monica mountains in August 2010, a year after she had been reported missing.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic sculptors can create a face in the likeness of a victim, often leading to the naming of unidentified corpses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Wedding season gets off to a bumpy start when there is confusion over a bridal gown, and the salon opens with its monthly sample sale of designer dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: During the sample sale, a brother and sister hunt for the perfect dress, and the new members of staff are put under pressure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: To Buy or Not to Buy
programme.desc: Claudia's professional problems continue, resulting in more meetings. Plus, a woman from Buffalo brings her fiance to the store.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman travels from Romania and finds her ideal wedding dress in Kleinfeld Bridal Salon. However, it transpires she may not be able to afford it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part one of two. Disaster strikes when a bride's father is convinced his daughter's dress is not how they wanted it, but a designer saves the day by agreeing to customise the gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Part two of two. A crowd of women fils the salon in pursuit of the dream dress, while Claudia struggles with a client.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three collectors are given 800 euros to spend at a market in Arles, before returning to the UK, upcycling their goods and trying to make a profit selling them in St Albans.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals for which owners Lynette and David want big money. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lupe has been in hospital for two months, and must lose 75 pounds before surgery is possible. However, her doctor fears her husband is a bad influence.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: After a spate of murders in a small Louisiana town, detectives struggle to extract a confession from the suspect until they invoke the memory of his dead mother.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: A case in which a woman married, knowing nothing of her new husband's violent past. Soon however, Vernetta and her sister-in-law Karen had to deal with the aftermath of tragedy.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1976, a woman was left for dead in her home in California. Despite a major manhunt, the killer avoided detection for over 40 years, until DNA analysis was applied to evidence.
